name: Jimmy Cash
precedingDialogue: Mrs mayor, we have quite a bit of excess cash for city development, it is usually a good idea to invest these into something that can be useful down the road.
We have a few proposals from both small businesses and our local university asking us to support their projects, they all seem very interesting.
question: What would you like to fund?

transitions.label: An electric car company
transitions.feedback: Electric cars are all the rage these days, and they save the environment, what a deal!

transitions.label: A material science research group
transitions.feedback: Material science helps with industry, and that's money!

transitions.label: A clean energy research group
transitions.feedback: Clean energy is not easy, but it can save the world in the future!

name: Arvio
precedingDialogue: Greetings! My name is Arvio, but people call me Arvio The Wealthy
Why? I'm the proprietor of MineCroft Coal Mines and the wealthiest coal baron on the seven mountains
My team of Geo ...erm ...geolis ...scientists, say that this town's neighbouring mountains promises bounds of wealth'
I have a proposition for you, allow me to inspect those lands and I may consider helping out this dump *erherm* town
question: So what do you say friend? Do we have a deal?

transitions.label: There's a lot of money in coal. It's a deal!
transitions.feedback: Arvio brings his crew and begins inspecting your land

transitions.label: No deal, mining for coal will ruin the natural landscape!
transitions.feedback: Arvio leaves with a mischievous look on his face

name: Hunter Gatberg

question: Could you take me on a trip someday?

name: James the Dog
precedingDialogue: Mrs. Gatburg, your town has grown faster than expected. This is great as it means you're doing a great job making the town a nice place to live.
However, this growth has also meant that our infrastructure is having trouble catching up to demand, especially our power stations.
The high demand doubled the price of electricity and the townspeople are complaining, we should consider building a bigger power station.
question: Would you like to generate more power using solar panels or expand our coal plant?

transitions.label: Solar sounds like a good idea, it's environmentally friendly.
transitions.feedback: Solar panels are great for the environment, and with the efforts of the research group prices has been lowered significantly.
